CBInsightsDescription: Aceable is a mobile education platform that provides driving courses for customers based on their specific state's standards.

CBInsightsDescription: Age of Learning provides a comprehensive and engaging online curriculum for preschool, kindergarten, and early elementary school programs. QuidDescription: Age of Learning, Inc. offers online education resources. The company operates ABCmouse.com Early Learning Academy and ABCmouse English Learning Academy. The company offers ReadingIQ digital library, online books, educational games, puzzles, art activities, and printable on art illustrations. The company's platform offers traditional original stories, fiction books, and provides jigsaw cutout puzzles to develop problem solving critical thinking skills. CBInsightsDescription: Agilix was founded in 2001 to develop cloud-based education solutions that enable more meaningful and effective ways for students and educators to take control of the learning experience. QuidDescription: As of February 28, 2006, Agilix Corporation was acquired by PerkinElmer Inc. Agilix Corporation develops genomics and proteomics platform technologies for the systematic discovery and analysis of genes, protein products, and related biological functions. It offers GenCompass, a genome microarray platform that profiles genes of various organisms; and i-PROTTM Labeling technology, a protein labeling technology that allows protein profiling, in vivo labeling, and throughput assay development. Agilix Corporation was founded in 1999 and is based in New Haven, Connecticut.

CBInsightsDescription: Apex Learning is a provider of blended and virtual learning solutions to the nation's schools. The standards-based digital curriculum - in math, science, English, social studies, world languages, and Advanced Placement - is widely used for original credit, credit recovery, remediation, intervention, acceleration and exam preparation.
QuidDescription: Apex Learning Inc. offers standards-based digital learning solutions, including comprehensive courses and tutorials for secondary education. The company offers digital courses that include math, science, English, social studies, world languages, electives, CTE, and technology courses; middle school tutorials; high school tutorials for English, math, biology, and U.S. history; and college readiness and high school equivalency tutorials that target the skills and concepts needed for success on national exams. CBInsightsDescription: BetterUp operates as a mobile-based leadership development platform. Through on-demand, virtual coaching sessions, users can practice and reinforce new behaviors, mindsets and skills. Individual growth is measured and tracked.

CBInsightsDescription: Bitwise Industries is a tech ecosystem, activating human potential to elevate the technology industry in Fresno, CA. CBInsightsDescription: Blackboard is an education technology company that provides enterprise technology and solutions for teaching, learning, and student engagement. Blackboard's solutions allow higher education, K-12, professional, corporate, and government organizations to extend teaching and learning online, facilitate campus commerce and security, and communicate more effectively with their communities. Founded in 1997, Blackboard is headquartered in Washington, D.C., with offices in North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia.
QuidDescription: Blackboard ConnectTxt provides notification services. It offers Blackboard ConnectTxt, a two-way SMS service to send and receive text messages to multiple people from a computer or a smartphone; and Blackboard Connect 5, an enterprise-level, multimodal, multilingual mass notification service for education, government, and private sector institutions worldwide. The company also provides XML Connector for Web and application developers to interface their own applications with ConnectTxt services; SOAP Connector that enables developers to manage address books remotely; and email2txt, an application for developers, which allows email to be delivered to various mobile phone handsets as a text message. In addition, it offers Connect Data Uploader, an application for developers to automatically update the contact details in their address book from their institution's existing database; and programming APIs to integrate ConnectTxt functionality into a developerÂ’s existing application. Blackboard ConnectTxt was formerly known as txttools limited and changed its name to Blackboard ConnectTxt in February 2012. The company was founded in 2001 and is based in London, United Kingdom. As of January 31, 2011, Blackboard ConnectTxt operates as a subsidiary of Blackboard Connect Inc.

CBInsightsDescription: BrightBytes delivers tools and services that measure the impact of technology use on learning. The Clarity for Schools platform captures the link between school technology use and student achievement. This platform is informed by the close collaboration between educational researchers, school practitioners, data scientists, statisticians, and experienced system dynamics modelers.
QuidDescription: BrightBytes Inc. operates a SaaS-based data analytics platform that measures and links technology use in education to learning outcomes. It gathers ideas and creates evidence-based frameworks that are combined with data from a clientsÂ’ school or region giving them the tools to understand and improve student learning outcomes. The companyÂ’s platform provides information, such as intuitive infographics, data, actionable next steps, peer networks, and targeted stakeholder reports, as well as tracks and communicates progress for educational leaders. Its solutions address the unique needs of educational leaders, including government, service agencies, districts, and schools worldwide. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in San Francisco, California.
CrunchbaseDescription: BrightBytes is a SaaS-based data analytics platform that measures and links the use of technology to learning outcomes.

CBInsightsDescription: Cambly's app gives English learners instant 1-on-1 access to native speakers over video chat 24/7. Students get a convenient way to practice their English and gain confidence. Tutors get to make money helping people from around the world practice English.

CBInsightsDescription: CampusLogic is a cloud-based college search-to-graduation student engagement platform which enables students and families to understand the costs of college early in the enrollment process, complete financial aid forms, and access digital award letters - all from their mobile phone.
QuidDescription: CampusLogic, Inc. develops a cloud-based student financial success platform used by college officials to help students manage scholarships, loans, and other financial supports. The company serves public, private, and community college. CampusLogic, Inc. was incorporated in 2009 and is based in Chandler, Arizona.

CBInsightsDescription: Civitas Learning is a student success intelligence platform leveraging each institution's unique data to find and distribute the clearest path to improved higher education outcomes.

The company also offers illume, an application that provides a view of a given institutionÂ’s historical and predictive student flow; and Inspire for Faculty, aggregates data from the companyÂ’s platform to uncover specific insights for specific users, and visualizes these data on studentsÂ’ measurable engagement patterns in real-time for analysis. CBInsightsDescription: Coursera (NYSE: COUR) offers classes from universities and professors online for free. CBInsightsDescription: creativeLIVE is a live online creative classroom offering free education in photography, filmmaking, web design and more. CBInsightsDescription: Declara is focused on bringing data to life. The company, founded in 2012, builds a technology platform that uses machine learning, search, algorithms and recommendations to develop specific learning paths for individuals, making learning a constant discovery. Instead of giving every person the identical learning path, the Declara platform surfaces the right content in the right context. Based on an individual's interactions with informational data - blogs, web sites and documents - and social data - tweets, posts, colleagues, experts - the Declara platform creates a CognitiveGraph giving every individual their own personalized learning path. This platform is already being used to drive learning across a diverse group of organizations to accelerate innovation; increase efficiency and drive large-scale transformations.
QuidDescription: Declara, Inc. provides an intelligent social learning platform that connects people to content. Its platform features include social collaboration, intuitive search, content creation, intelligent chat, live mentoring, assessment, and progress tracking. The company provides analytics on how people learn, what content they use/generate, and which peers and mentors help them for customers to own and improve their learning, as well as content providers to refine their products and organizational leaders. It serves governments, companies, educational institutions, and research organizations. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Palo Alto, California. As of April 11, 2019, Declara, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Futuryng Inc.
CrunchbaseDescription: Declara makes is easy to discover, collect, and share knowledge with a community of like-minded people.

QuidDescription: Degreed, Inc. provides a learning platform to track, discover, and recognize learning. CBInsightsDescription: DreamBox Learning has developed an Intelligent Adaptive Learning Platform that captures mouse clicks to personalize math learning and adapts it to any student. CBInsightsDescription: Echo360 provides a platform to capture, host, and deliver classroom lecture and supplemental materials to higher-education institutions.
QuidDescription: Echo360, Inc. develops and provides a Software-as-a-Service learning and analytics solution for higher education in the United States and internationally. Its platform also allows users to record instructional videos for students; and connects students and instructors around the world, as well as provides learning analytics and indicators that enable the instructor to know the students participating and identify struggling students before the exam time. In addition, the companyÂ’s platform provides a learning library that stores videos, presentations, and documents. Further, it provides universal capture software for faculty, students, and administrators with Mac or Windows devices to record the screen of their personal device, as well as capture scheduled and on-demand lecture in the classroom; an automatic speech recognition solution that enable colleges and universities to offer video-based learning experiences; and video content management system and various support services. The company was founded in 2007 and is based in Reston, Virginia. Echo360, Inc. was formerly a subsidiary of blinkx, Inc.

QuidDescription: EdCast Inc. operates an artificial intelligence powered knowledge cloud platform for personalized learning. CBInsightsDescription: EdisonLearning is an international educational solutions provider that pioneered the concept of charter schools in the U.S. EdisonLearning helps schools achieve lasting gains in performance, using an extensive portfolio of proven K-12 solutions, including Dropout Prevention and Recovery Centers, School Turnaround services focused on improving underperforming schools, brick and mortar schools, and virtual schools and programs. QuidDescription: Edmodo, Inc. operates an online platform that enables educators to connect and collaborate with students, parents, and each other. The company also provides Webinar series; e-learning software training; e-learning resources, such as graphic design tips, instructional design tips, and eLearning stuff; an interaction builder, an online software that lets users choose from a library of interactions and games; and adobe connect game for virtual training. eLearning Brothers, LLC was founded in 2009 and is based in American Fork, Utah with additional offices in Florida, New York, Ohio, and London, United Kingdom.

CBInsightsDescription: Examity provides a test integrity solution including live, recorded and automated solutions ensure integrity of online education and certification programs from higher education institutions and other organizations. QuidDescription: Examity, LLC provides live online proctoring for academic institutions and universities by using a webcam to monitor students taking exams online to prevent cheating. Examity, LLC was formerly known as Secure Proctor, LLC and changed its name to Examity, LLC in September 2013. The company was incorporated in 2012 and is based in Needham, Massachusetts. It also has an office in Newton, Massachusetts.

CBInsightsDescription: HotChalk is a learning environment for K-12 teachers, students and parents that includes a learning management system (LMS), a library of teacher-contributed lesson plans, premium digital content, and professional development for teachers in a Web-based environment. CrunchbaseDescription: Illuminate Education provides innovative tools that educators can use to promote student and educator success.

CBInsightsDescription: InnoCentive connects companies, academic institutions, public sector and non-profit organizations in the crowdsourcing platform Open Innovation Marketplace.On July 10th, 2020, InnoCentive was acquired by Wazoku. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
QuidDescription: InnoCentive, Inc. offers a cloud based innovation management platform to help companies, corporations, public sector agencies, governments, and nonprofits to find solutions to their pressing problems. The company offers, InnoCentive@Work, a collaborative SaaS-based innovation management software solution that enables users to engage diverse innovation communities, such as employees, partners, and customers to help them to generate novel ideas and solve their pressing problems. It also provides externally crowd sourced challenge programs and innovation competitions to solve problems and breakthrough innovations; InnoCentive Idea Management, a SaaS-based idea generation software platform for innovation idea creation, idea sharing, and knowledge sharing from employees and invited audiences in a well-structured environment. The company serves customers in the United States and internationally. InnoCentive, Inc. has strategic partnerships with Nature Publishing Group, and Scientific American. The company was formerly known as Innocentive Innovation, Inc. InnoCentive, Inc. was founded in 2001 and is based in Waltham, Massachusetts, with an additional headquarters in London, United Kingdom.
CrunchbaseDescription: InnoCentive is an open innovation company that crowdsources commission research and development problems.

CBInsightsDescription: Intradiem, formerly Knowlagent, provides call center software that increases agent utilization through automated intraday management and dynamic delivery of coaching, training, communications, and other off-phone, shrinkage activities during idle time. Intradiem's call center software, which improves call center productivity, is on-demand, easy to use and requires no capital expenditures.
QuidDescription: Intradiem, Inc. provides intraday automation solutions for multi-channel contact centers. It offers task management, real-time adherence, intraday staffing, channel balancing, alerts and notifications, and reskilling solutions. The company also provides implementation, training, consulting, managed services, success management, and customer support services. It serves companies in telecommunications, financial services, and healthcare industries, as well as outsourcers worldwide. Intradiem, Inc. was formerly known as Knowlagent, Inc. and changed its name to Intradiem, Inc. in January 2013. The company was founded in 1995 and is based in Alpharetta, Georgia.
CrunchbaseDescription: Intradiem is a software compay that provides an Intelligent Assistant for customer service teams.

CBInsightsDescription: Kaltura provides an Open Source Online Video Platform, transforming the way people work, learn, and entertain using online video. The Kaltura platform engages viewers by providing media companies advanced video management, publishing, and monetization tools that increase reach and monetization and simplify video operations. Kaltura improves productivity and interaction among employees by providing enterprises online video tools for boosting internal knowledge sharing, training, and collaboration, and for more effective marketing. Kaltura offers next generation learning for students and teachers by providing educational institutions online video solutions for improved teaching, learning, and increased engagement across campuses and beyond.
QuidDescription: Kaltura Inc. provides various Software-as-a-Service products and solutions and a Platform-as-a-Service. It offers video products, such as video portal, town halls, video messaging, webinars, and virtual events and meetings for video-based communication, collaboration, training, and customer experience; and video industry solutions, such as learning management system video solution and lecture capture and virtual classroom solution for educational institutions. The companyÂ’s Video Experience Cloud offers live, real-time, and on-demand video products including Video Portal, Town Halls, Video Messaging, Webinars, Virtual Events and Meetings. It also offers specialized industry solutions, including Learning Management System Video, Lecture Capture and Virtual Classroom for educational institutions, as well as a TV Solution for media and telecom companies. In addition, the company offers a TV Solution that allows to provide OTT advertising and subscription-based live and on-demand TV services for media companies and telecom operators. It provides media services, such as APIs, SDKs, and experience components, including live, real-time, and on-demand video ingestion, transcoding, management, search, security, distribution, publishing, engagement, monetization, and analytics, as well as video and TV content management systems. It serves a range of industries, including financial services, high technology, healthcare, education, public sector, media, and telecommunications. Kaltura Inc. was incorporated in 2006 and is based in New York, New York.
CrunchbaseDescription: Video Platform as a Service and Enterprise SaaS Video Applications

CBInsightsDescription: Kidaptive is a media and technology company dedicated to smart storytelling on iPads and a curriculum developed in collaboration with Stanford University researchers to create entertaining and adaptive content that helps children learn. The company's first product, Leo's Pad, will engage preschool-aged children with games, puzzles, and projects woven into an immersive story arc. The technology will use embedded assessments to customize learning, support metacognitive development, and provide parents with applicable intelligence and useful tips about how to further support a child's progress and interests.On March 16th, 2021 Kidaptive was acquired by McGraw Hill. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
QuidDescription: Kidaptive, Inc. develops interactive educational content for preschoolers. The company's products include Leo's Pad, a series of interactive educational applications for children and Parent's Pad, a built-in assessment tool for parents; Adaptive Learning Platform (ALP) brings together observations from across contexts, which include tiles in mosaic, producing a detailed picture of that learner progress and preferences. Kidaptive, Inc. was founded in 2011 and is based in Redwood City, California. As of March 16, 2021, Kidaptive, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of McGraw-Hill Education, Inc.
CrunchbaseDescription: Kidaptive is a media and technology company creating entertaining and adaptive content that helps children learn.

CBInsightsDescription: Knewton engages in adaptive learning PaaS technology, which continuously personalizes online learning content for individual students.
QuidDescription: Knewton, Inc. provides an online adaptive learning engine. It offers Knewton, a platform that provides students with tailored recommendations for exactly what to study; teachers with analytics to better support each student; and publishers with content insights to develop more effective digital products. The company also provides adaptive learning solutions for higher education students in various subjects that include math, economics, reading and writing, biology, anatomy and physiology, chemistry, physics, engineering, and finance and accounting; and Alta, an integrated adaptive learning courseware for higher education. Its technology is used by educational companies and institutions. Knewton, Inc. was founded in 2008 and is based in New York, New York with additional offices in London, United Kingdom and Tokyo, Japan.
CrunchbaseDescription: Knewton is an adaptive learning technology provider with a mission to bring personalized education to the world.

CBInsightsDescription: Knowledge Holdings, through its subsidiary, Knowledge Adventure, offers kids' software, creating educational products for use in the home and the classroom. Knowledge Adventure's JumpStart and MathBlaster products invite kids to learn through gaming adventures in 3D virtual worlds. By blending learning and entertainment, Knowledge Adventure's adventure-based learning inspires kids' minds through immersed play. A subsidiary of Knowledge Holdings, the company is privately-held and based in Torrance, California.
QuidDescription: Knowledge Holdings, Inc., through its subsidiary JumpStart Games, Inc., develops, publishes, and distributes multimedia educational software and products for use in home and classroom. The company was incorporated in 2004 and is based in Torrance, California.
CrunchbaseDescription: Knowledge Adventure provides 3D-based, educational childrenâ€™s software for home and classroom use.

CBInsightsDescription: Lesson.ly makes training software for growing businesses. With tools to build, share, and track lessons and courses, Lesson.ly helps get teams up-to-speed and keep them there, no training background required.
QuidDescription: Lessonly, LLC offers training software solutions for teams to learn and practice. It offers Lessonly, a training software solution that enables users to build, share, and track their training materials. The companyÂ’s Lessonly offers customer service training software, sales enablement software, new employee on-boarding software, online training software, on-the-job training software, employee training software, and learning management systems. It serves B2B, B2C, retail, and healthcare industries. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Indianapolis, Indiana.
CrunchbaseDescription: Lessonly is a simple training software that helps teams learn, practice, and do better work.

CBInsightsDescription: littleBits is the New York-based hardware startup that is empowering kids everywhere to become inventors. Through its platform of easy-to-use electronic building blocks, littleBits allows anyone to create and prototype with electronics, independent of age, gender or technical ability. By embracing STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Mathematics), both girls and boys can invent solutions to the problems that matter to them.
QuidDescription: littleBits Electronics Inc. develops and provides electronic building blocks that snap together with magnets to enable users to build, invent, and prototype with electronics. The company offers littleBits modules, circuit-boards with functions engineered to snap together with magnets. Additionally, it provides hardware development kits; USB and power modules; remote triggers and oscillators; micro sequencers and keyboards; toggle switches and light sensors; and accessories. littleBits Electronics Inc. was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in New York, New York. As of August 23, 2019, littleBits Electronics Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Sphero, Inc.
CrunchbaseDescription: LittleBits is an open-source library of electronic modules that allows users to learn electronics via prototypes.

CBInsightsDescription: MasteryConnect is a provider in curriculum, assessment and mastery learning tools for K-12. MasteryConnect makes it much easier for teachers to identify and track students levels of understanding against any set of standards, so they can engage more deeply with students. MasteryConnect supports teachers via its Mastery Learning Platform, as well as through their numerous apps on all Web-enabled devices.
QuidDescription: MasteryConnect Inc. operates an online community for educators in the United States. The company allows educators to connect with their colleagues, share and discover common assessments and resources, track mastery of standards, and collaborate. Its platform facilitates teachers to share assessments of various curriculum types, such as multiple choice, open-answer, rubrics, writing, and oral assessments; pin and discover standards aligned resources; save time with built-in grading tools, such as tablet, mobile device, web browser, and GradeCam bubblesheet scanning; and join the learning community. The company also offers Teacher App for Android to make mobile-enabled formative and performance-based assessment available to teachers using any smart device. MasteryConnect Inc. was founded in 2009 and is based in Sandy, Utah. As of April 5, 2019, MasteryConnect Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Instructure, Inc.
CrunchbaseDescription: MasteryConnect is an assessment and curriculum platform that provides innovative tools for teachers.

CBInsightsDescription: MPOWER is a fintech company and provider of educational loans to high-promise international students who do not fit the traditional credit criteria of banks or lenders. The company's mission is to remove the financial barriers to higher education in the United States by providing the financial resources necessary for these students to attend and complete their undergraduate or graduate education.
QuidDescription: MPOWER Financing, Public Benefit Corporation provides educational loans to international and DACA students studying in the United States and Canada. Its loans are used to cover student related expenses, such as basic tuition, housing, food, insurance, and books. The company also provides flexible funding options. In addition, it has partnered with various universities to identify potential candidates for loans. The company was incorporated in 2014 and is based in Washington, District of Columbia with additional offices worldwide.
CrunchbaseDescription: MPOWER Financing is a social benefit corporation financing domestic and international students.

CBInsightsDescription: Mursion leverages artificial intelligence and live human interaction to provide VR training for essential skills in the workplace. Simulations are designed for the modern workforce, staging interactions between learners and avatars to achieve the realism needed for measurable, high-impact results.
QuidDescription: Mursion, Inc. develops a virtual reality environment where professionals practice and master the complex interpersonal skills. It offers Mursion, a virtual reality platform that delivers personalized simulations by using a combination of artificial intelligence and live actors; provides a range of workplace environments in which to simulate challenging interpersonal exchanges; and forces learners to take risks from which they could learn how to improve their day-to-day performance. The company platform is used by a range of organizations in healthcare, education, hospitality, finance, and other corporate sectors. Mursion, Inc. was formerly known as AMITIES, INC. and changed its name to Mursion, Inc. in May 2015. The company was incorporated in 2014 and is headquartered in San Francisco, California with an additional office in San Francisco, California.
CrunchbaseDescription: Mursion, a virtual reality environment or platform where professionals practice and master the complex interpersonal skills.

CBInsightsDescription: Mytonomy's Cloud for Healthcare helps healthcare organizations give patients what they need to care for themselves in the palm of their hands. Mytonomy engages patients in their care with attention-getting, broadcast-quality micro-learning videos, and a powerful suite of communication and survey tools for continuous improvement. Orchestrated by an intelligent healthcare CRM, Mytonomy adapts to each patient to deliver a tailored experience that helps them manage chronic conditions, better prepare for invasive procedures, and more accurately adhere to post-discharge treatment plans. This is a foundational element in driving digital transformation and a new model of virtual care. As a result, Mytonomy enables organizations to achieve better results and helps patients get healthier.
QuidDescription: Mytonomy, Inc. provides microlearning software and specialized content solutions for patient education. The company delivers SaaS solutions to catalyze self-efficacy in patients helping them reach their health potential; and enables hospitals to deliver health care using systematic patient and caregiver instruction. It serves hospitals, patients, and caregivers. The company was founded in 2011 and is based in Bethesda, Maryland.
CrunchbaseDescription: MytonomyÂ® helps healthcare organizations give patients what they need to care for themselves â€“ in the palm of their hands.

CBInsightsDescription: Nearpod offers an all-in-one solution for the synchronized use of mobile devices in the classroom. The platform allows teachers to create and customize interactive mobile presentations.On February 19th, 2021, Nearpod was acquired by Renaissance at a valuation of $650M.
QuidDescription: Nearpod Inc. develops a cloud-based platform to enhance the learning process in classrooms and distance learning. It offers Nearpod, a solution for the synchronized use of iPads in the classroom that enables instructors to launch interactive multimedia presentations to engage their students and assess their work with the use of iPads. The company also operates a Nearpod certified educatorÂ’s community where it shows webinar, lessons, and training materials. It also offers curriculum services, such as Nearpod lesson library, digital citizenship and literacy, college and career exploration, English learners, social emotional learning, historical perspectives and literacy, and learning labs. The company was founded in 2011 and is based in Dania Beach, Florida with an additional office in Brooklyn, New York. As of March 12, 2021, Nearpod Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Renaissance Learning Inc.
CrunchbaseDescription: Nearpod is a provider of edtech platform for K-12 teachers to create interactive slides filled with videos, quizzes, and other activities.

CBInsightsDescription: Newsela unlocks the written word by publishing daily news articles from media sources like the Associated Press, Washington Post, Tribune News Service and Scientific American at five reading levels to engage students in grades 2-12 in high-interest topics from immigration and diplomacy to drones and animal extinction.
QuidDescription: Newsela, Inc. publishes online news articles daily to help students master the advanced literacy skills. It offers news on war and peace, science, kids, money, law, health, arts, and sports categories. Newsela, Inc. was formerly known as Whipsmart Learning LLC. The company was founded in 2013 and is based in New York, New York.
CrunchbaseDescription: Newsela is an Ed-tech startup that takes content from trusted providers and turns it into learning materials.

CBInsightsDescription: Niche is a research site that helps people intelligently choose schools and places to live. By blending millions of community reviews and opinions with hard data, the company makes choosing a college, K-12 school, or place to live a more transparent process.
QuidDescription: Niche.com Inc. operates an online platform that allows users to discover the schools, companies, and neighborhoods in the United States. Its platform offers reviews, analysis, rankings, report cards, and profiles for K-12 schools, colleges, graduate schools, and places to live. Niche.com Inc. was formerly known as College Prowler, Inc. The company was founded in 2002 and is based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
CrunchbaseDescription: Niche.com is a platform that enables users to discover and research U.S. colleges, schools, neighborhoods, and companies.

CBInsightsDescription: Noodle Partners focuses on helping colleges and universities create and manage online and hybrid programs.
QuidDescription: Noodle Partners, Inc. develops and provides an online education infrastructure platform to allow universities and colleges to offer online services and programs. It enables universities to build certificate or degree programs in the areas of marketing, student recruitment, enrollment, curriculum design, social engagement, support services, graduate placement, and alumni engagement. The company also provides services in the areas of student recruitment, instructional design and faculty support, counseling and support for students, community and social engagement, job and career placement, alumni engagement, dashboards, and financing. Noodle Partners, Inc. was incorporated in 2013 and is based in New York, New York.
CrunchbaseDescription: Noodle is an organization that connects students with schools, programs, resources, and experts.

CBInsightsDescription: Open English is an online school created to reinvent the English-language-learning experience. Through live instruction with native English speaking teachers and multimedia learning materials, all provided over the Internet, Open English empowers students on their customized path to English fluency in a 12-month time period.
QuidDescription: Open English Tutoring Ltd provides non-instructional activities that support educational processes and systems. Open English Tutoring Ltd was incorporated in 2018 and is based in Hemel Hempstead, United Kingdom.
CrunchbaseDescription: Open English is an educational technology company focused on English language learning for the Latin American and U.S. Hispanic markets.

CBInsightsDescription: OpenSesame helps develop productive workforces by offering a comprehensive catalog of elearning courses. The company supports companies in finding courses, mapping them to core competencies, syncing them with a learning management system (LMS) to increase utilization and improve learning & development (L&D) programs.
QuidDescription: OpenSesame Inc. operates an online marketplace for e-learning courses. Its platform allows users to preview courses, read reviews, and research sellers of online training courses. The company has a strategic partnership with Aasonn, LLC. OpenSesame Inc. was founded in 2011 and is based in Portland, Oregon with an additional office in London, United Kingdom.
CrunchbaseDescription: OpenSesame is an e-learning company that provides online training courses for businesses and employees.

CBInsightsDescription: Orbis Education creates, markets, and manages collaborative nursing education solutions that alleviate nursing shortages for hospitals and healthcare systems. The company leverages alliances with nursing schools to provide flexible, customized, baccalaureate level programs. Orbis powers the growth of online programs by facilitating operations, management, student recruitment and the technology behind the program.
QuidDescription: Orbis Education Services, LLC provides solutions to healthcare workforce shortages. The company creates partnerships between academic institutions and employers managing clinically healthcare programs, such as nursing and occupational therapy. It provides services, including upfront capital investment, innovative academic platforms, and clinical placement partnerships. Orbis Education Services, LLC was founded in 2003 and is based in Indianapolis, Indiana. As of January 22, 2019, Orbis Education Services, LLC operates as a subsidiary of Grand Canyon Education, Inc.
CrunchbaseDescription: Orbis Education provides collaborative nursing education solutions that alleviate nursing shortages for hospitals and healthcare systems.

CBInsightsDescription: Osso VR is a virtual reality surgical training tech company that provides surgeons, sales teams, and other trainees with an on-demand training platform featuring realistic, haptic-enhanced, interactions in an immersive training environment. It is device agnostic, and is currently compatible with Oculus Rift/Touch and HTC Vive hardware. Through analytics dashboards, trainees and administrators can receive feedback regarding their run-throughs and tailored guidance to help them reach proficiency.
QuidDescription: Osso VR Inc. develops virtual reality surgical training platform for orthopedic and other medical specialties. The product consists of realistic and haptic-enhanced interactions in an immersive training environment to simulate surgical processes. Additionally, it offers analytic dashboards and tailored guidance for the procedure. The company offers its product to surgeons, sales teams, and medical trainees. Osso VR Inc. was founded in 2016 and is based in Palo Alto, California.
CrunchbaseDescription: Osso VR is a training and assessment platform focused on surgical virtual reality.

CBInsightsDescription: Outschool is a marketplace of live online classes for kids. Classes meet in small-groups over live video-chat and are offered by independent teachers direct to parents.
QuidDescription: Outschool, Inc. operates an education platform that offers a range of engaging and small-group classes online. The companyÂ’s platform connects real-life teachers with learners. It serves employers and schools. Outschool, Inc. was formerly known as Banjo Helmet, Inc. The company was incorporated in 2014 and is based in San Francisco, California.
CrunchbaseDescription: Outschool is a marketplace of live online classes for kids that connects learners, parents, and teachers together.

CBInsightsDescription: Panorama Education partners with K-12 schools to collect and analyze feedback from teachers, parents and students. Panorama's technology platform helps teachers grow, and schools use Panorama's tools to address issues such as parent involvement, bullying prevention, school safety and student engagement.
QuidDescription: Panorama Education Group specializes in the field of education. It is based in China.
CrunchbaseDescription: Panorama Education brings the power of data to education through a SaaS platform used by hundreds of school districts across the US.
